name: Jewel Orchid
description: This vining plant features trailing or climbing growth with beautiful, intricate flowers. Belongs to the ludisia genus. Prized more for their beautiful leaves than flowers, unlike most orchids. The intricate vein patterns on leaves resemble precious metalwork, with some species having iridescent or metallic-looking patterns. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds exotic elegance with its stunning veined foliage and unique growth habit.
careTips: Grown primarily for its beautiful foliage, not flowers
Low to medium indirect light - avoid direct sunlight
Water when top 3 cm of substrate is dry
Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy
Well-draining mix is essential - can incorporate Molar Clay
Rhizomatous growth habit - spreads via runners
Excellent for terrarium groundcover or as houseplant
Relatively easy to grow compared to epiphytic orchids
Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
